param.name: ArduSub:SURFACE_DEPTH
param.documentation: The depth the external pressure sensor will read when the vehicle is considered at the surface (in centimeters)

param.name: ArduSub:SYSID_SW_MREV
param.documentation: This value is incremented when changes are made to the eeprom format

param.name: ArduSub:SYSID_SW_TYPE
param.documentation: This is used by the ground station to recognise the software type (eg ArduPlane vs ArduCopter)

param.humanName: MAVLink system ID of this vehicle
param.name: ArduSub:SYSID_THISMAV
param.documentation: Allows setting an individual MAVLink system id for this vehicle to distinguish it from others on the same network

param.name: ArduSub:SYSID_MYGCS
param.documentation: Allows restricting radio overrides to only come from my ground station

param.name: ArduSub:CLI_ENABLED
param.documentation: This enables/disables the checking for three carriage returns on telemetry links on startup to enter the diagnostics command line interface

param.name: ArduSub:PILOT_THR_FILT
param.documentation: Throttle filter cutoff (Hz) - active whenever altitude control is inactive - 0 to disable

param.name: ArduSub:PILOT_TKOFF_ALT
param.documentation: Altitude that altitude control modes will climb to when a takeoff is triggered with the throttle stick.

param.name: ArduSub:PILOT_TKOFF_DZ
param.documentation: Offset from mid stick at which takeoff is triggered

param.name: ArduSub:PILOT_THR_BHV
param.documentation: Bits for: Feedback starts from mid stick

param.name: ArduSub:TELEM_DELAY
param.documentation: The amount of time (in seconds) to delay radio telemetry to prevent an Xbee bricking on power up

param.name: ArduSub:GCS_PID_MASK
param.documentation: bitmask of PIDs to send MAVLink PID_TUNING messages for

param.name: ArduSub:RTL_ALT
param.documentation: The minimum relative altitude the model will move to before Returning to Launch. Set to zero to return at current altitude.

param.name: ArduSub:RTL_CONE_SLOPE
param.documentation: Defines a cone above home which determines maximum climb

param.name: ArduSub:RTL_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally while flying home. If this is set to zero, WPNAV_SPEED will be used instead.

param.name: ArduSub:RNGFND_GAIN
param.documentation: Used to adjust the speed with which the target altitude is changed when objects are sensed below the copter

param.name: ArduSub:FS_BATT_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked when battery voltage or current runs low

param.name: ArduSub:FS_BATT_VOLTAGE
param.documentation: Battery voltage to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery voltage failsafe. If the battery voltage drops below this voltage then the copter will RTL

param.name: ArduSub:FS_BATT_MAH
param.documentation: Battery capacity remaining to trigger failsafe. Set to 0 to disable battery remaining failsafe. If the battery remaining drops below this level then the copter will RTL

param.name: ArduSub:FS_GCS_ENABLE
param.documentation: Controls whether failsafe will be invoked (and what action to take) when connection with Ground station is lost for at least 5 seconds. NB. The GCS Failsafe is only active when RC_OVERRIDE is being used to control the vehicle.

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

param.name: ArduSub:GPS_HDOP_GOOD
param.documentation: GPS Hdop value at or below this value represent a good position. Used for pre-arm checks

param.name: ArduSub:MAG_ENABLE
param.documentation: Setting this to Enabled(1) will enable the compass. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable the compass

param.name: ArduSub:SUPER_SIMPLE
param.documentation: Bitmask to enable Super Simple mode for some flight modes. Setting this to Disabled(0) will disable Super Simple Mode

param.name: ArduSub:RTL_ALT_FINAL
param.documentation: This is the altitude the vehicle will move to as the final stage of Returning to Launch or after completing a mission. Set to zero to land.

param.name: ArduSub:RTL_CLIMB_MIN
param.documentation: The vehicle will climb this many cm during the initial climb portion of the RTL

param.name: ArduSub:WP_YAW_BEHAVIOR
param.documentation: Determines how the autopilot controls the yaw during missions and RTL

param.name: ArduSub:RTL_LOIT_TIME
param.documentation: Time (in milliseconds) to loiter above home before beginning final descent

param.name: ArduSub:LAND_SPEED
param.documentation: The descent speed for the final stage of landing in cm/s

param.name: ArduSub:LAND_SPEED_HIGH
param.documentation: The descent speed for the first stage of landing in cm/s. If this is zero then WPNAV_SPEED_DN is used

param.name: ArduSub:PILOT_VELZ_MAX
param.documentation: The maximum vertical velocity the pilot may request in cm/s

param.name: ArduSub:PILOT_ACCEL_Z
param.documentation: The vertical acceleration used when pilot is controlling the altitude

param.name: ArduSub:THR_MIN
param.documentation: The minimum throttle that will be sent to the motors to keep them spinning

param.name: ArduSub:FS_THR_ENABLE
param.documentation: The throttle failsafe allows you to configure a software failsafe activated by a setting on the throttle input channel

values.value: Enabled Continue with Mission in Auto Mode

param.name: ArduSub:FS_THR_VALUE
param.documentation: The PWM level on channel 3 below which throttle sailsafe triggers

param.name: ArduSub:THR_MID
param.documentation: The throttle output (0 ~ 1000) when throttle stick is in mid position. Used to scale the manual throttle so that the mid throttle stick position is close to the throttle required to hover

param.name: ArduSub:THR_DZ
param.documentation: The deadzone above and below mid throttle. Used in AltHold, Loiter, PosHold flight modes

param.name: ArduSub:FLTMODE1
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is <= 1230

param.name: ArduSub:FLTMODE2
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1230, <= 1360

param.name: ArduSub:FLTMODE3
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1360, <= 1490

param.name: ArduSub:FLTMODE4
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1490, <= 1620

param.name: ArduSub:FLTMODE5
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >1620, <= 1749

param.name: ArduSub:FLTMODE6
param.documentation: Flight mode when Channel 5 pwm is >=1750

param.name: ArduSub:SIMPLE
param.documentation: Bitmask which holds which flight modes use simple heading mode (eg bit 0 = 1 means Flight Mode 0 uses simple mode)

param.name: ArduSub:LOG_BITMASK
param.documentation: 4 byte bitmap of log types to enable

param.name: ArduSub:ESC_CALIBRATION
param.documentation: Controls whether ArduCopter will enter ESC calibration on the next restart. Do not adjust this parameter manually.

values.value: Start-up in ESC Calibration mode if throttle high
Start-up in ESC Calibration mode regardless of throttle

param.name: ArduSub:TUNE
param.documentation: Controls which parameters (normally PID gains) are being tuned with transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduSub:TUNE_LOW
param.documentation: The minimum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduSub:TUNE_HIGH
param.documentation: The maximum value that will be applied to the parameter currently being tuned with the transmitter's channel 6 knob

param.name: ArduSub:FRAME
param.documentation: Controls motor mixing for multicopters. Not used for Tri or Traditional Helicopters.

param.name: ArduSub:CH7_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH7 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduSub:CH8_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH8 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduSub:CH9_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH9 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduSub:CH10_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH10 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduSub:CH11_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH11 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduSub:CH12_OPT
param.documentation: Select which function if performed when CH12 is above 1800 pwm

param.name: ArduSub:ARMING_CHECK
param.documentation: Allows enabling or disabling of pre-arming checks of receiver, accelerometer, barometer, compass and GPS

param.name: ArduSub:DISARM_DELAY
param.documentation: Delay before automatic disarm in seconds. A value of zero disables auto disarm.

param.name: ArduSub:ANGLE_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum lean angle in all flight modes

param.name: ArduSub:RC_FEEL_RP
param.documentation: RC feel for roll/pitch which controls vehicle response to user input with 0 being extremely soft and 100 being crisp

param.name: ArduSub:PHLD_BRAKE_RATE
param.documentation: PosHold flight mode's rotation rate during braking in deg/sec

param.name: ArduSub:PHLD_BRAKE_ANGLE
param.documentation: PosHold flight mode's max lean angle during braking in centi-degrees

param.name: ArduSub:LAND_REPOSITION
param.documentation: Enables user input during LAND mode, the landing phase of RTL, and auto mode landings.

param.name: ArduSub:FS_EKF_ACTION
param.documentation: Controls the action that will be taken when an EKF failsafe is invoked

param.name: ArduSub:FS_EKF_THRESH
param.documentation: Allows setting the maximum acceptable compass and velocity variance

param.name: ArduSub:FS_CRASH_CHECK
param.documentation: This enables automatic crash checking. When enabled the motors will disarm if a crash is detected.

param.name: ArduSub:RC_SPEED
param.documentation: This is the speed in Hertz that your ESCs will receive updates

param.humanName: Acro Roll and Pitch P gain
param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_RP_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot roll and pitch into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO and SPORT mode. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_YAW_P
param.documentation: Converts pilot yaw input into a desired rate of rotation in ACRO, Stabilize and SPORT modes. Higher values mean faster rate of rotation.

param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_BAL_ROLL
param.documentation: rate at which roll angle returns to level in acro mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_BAL_PITCH
param.documentation: rate at which pitch angle returns to level in acro mode. A higher value causes the vehicle to return to level faster.

param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_TRAINER
param.documentation: Type of trainer used in acro mode

param.name: ArduSub:ACRO_EXPO
param.documentation: Acro roll/pitch Expo to allow faster rotation when stick at edges

param.name: ArduSub:VEL_XY_P
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) P gain. Converts the difference between desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: ArduSub:VEL_XY_I
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired velocity to a target acceleration

param.name: ArduSub:VEL_XY_IMAX
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) integrator maximum. Constrains the target acceleration that the I gain will output

param.name: ArduSub:VEL_XY_FILT_HZ
param.documentation: Velocity (horizontal) filter frequency in Hz

param.name: ArduSub:VEL_Z_P
param.documentation: Velocity (vertical) P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical speed and actual speed into a desired acceleration that is passed to the throttle acceleration controller

param.name: ArduSub:ACCEL_Z_P
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration into a motor output

param.name: ArduSub:ACCEL_Z_I
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired vertical acceleration and actual acceleration

param.humanName: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduSub:ACCEL_Z_IMAX
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum pwm that the I term will generate

param.name: ArduSub:ACCEL_Z_D
param.documentation: Throttle acceleration controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired vertical acceleration vs actual acceleration

param.name: ArduSub:ACCEL_Z_FILT
param.documentation: Filter applied to acceleration to reduce noise. Lower values reduce noise but add delay.

param.name: ArduSub:POS_Z_P
param.documentation: Position (vertical) controller P gain. Converts the difference between the desired altitude and actual altitude into a climb or descent rate which is passed to the throttle rate controller

param.name: ArduSub:POS_XY_P
param.documentation: Loiter position controller P gain. Converts the distance (in the latitude direction) to the target location into a desired speed which is then passed to the loiter latitude rate controller

param.humanName: Precision landing velocity controller P gain
param.name: ArduSub:PRECLNDVEL_P
param.documentation: Precision landing velocity controller P gain

param.humanName: Precision landing velocity controller I gain
param.name: ArduSub:PRECLNDVEL_I
param.documentation: Precision landing velocity controller I gain

param.humanName: Precision landing velocity controller I gain maximum
param.name: ArduSub:PRECLNDVEL_IMAX
param.documentation: Precision landing velocity controller I gain maximum

param.name: ArduSub:AUTOTUNE_AXES
param.documentation: 1-byte bitmap of axes to autotune

param.name: ArduSub:AUTOTUNE_AGGR
param.documentation: Autotune aggressiveness. Defines the bounce back used to detect size of the D term.

param.name: ArduSub:AUTOTUNE_MIN_D
param.documentation: Defines the minimum D gain

param.humanName: Start motors before throwing is detected
param.name: ArduSub:THROW_MOT_START
param.documentation: Used by THROW mode. Controls whether motors will run at the speed set by THR_MIN or will be stopped when armed and waiting for the throw.

param.name: ArduSub:TERRAIN_FOLLOW
param.documentation: This enables terrain following for RTL and LAND flight modes. To use this option TERRAIN_ENABLE must be 1 and the GCS must support sending terrain data to the aircraft. In RTL the RTL_ALT will be considered a height above the terrain. In LAND mode the vehicle will slow to LAND_SPEED 10m above terrain (instead of 10m above home). This parameter does not affect AUTO and Guided which use a per-command flag to determine if the height is above-home, absolute or above-terrain.

values.value: Do Not Use in RTL and Land 1

param.name: SERIAL0_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the USB console. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL1_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the Telem1 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL1_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used on the Telem1 port. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL2_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol to use on the Telem2 port. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL2_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate of the Telem2 port. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL3_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial 3 (GPS) should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL3_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for the Serial 3 (GPS). The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL4_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial4 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL4_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial4. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: SERIAL5_PROTOCOL
param.documentation: Control what protocol Serial5 port should be used for. Note that the Frsky options require external converter hardware. See the wiki for details.

param.name: SERIAL5_BAUD
param.documentation: The baud rate used for Serial5. The APM2 can support all baudrates up to 115, and also can support 500. The PX4 can support rates of up to 1500. If you setup a rate you cannot support on APM2 and then can't connect to your board you should load a firmware from a different vehicle type. That will reset all your parameters to defaults.

param.name: RC1_MIN
param.documentation: RC minimum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_TRIM
param.documentation: RC trim (neutral) PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_MAX
param.documentation: RC maximum PWM pulse width. Typically 1000 is lower limit, 1500 is neutral and 2000 is upper limit.

param.name: RC1_REV
param.documentation: Reverse servo operation. Set to 1 for normal (forward) operation. Set to -1 to reverse this channel.

param.name: RC1_DZ
param.documentation: dead zone around trim or bottom

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_TYPE
param.documentation: how to trigger the camera to take a picture

param.humanName: Duration that shutter is held open
param.name: CAM_DURATION
param.documentation: How long the shutter will be held open in 10ths of a second (i.e. enter 10 for 1second, 50 for 5seconds)

param.name: CAM_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is activated

param.name: CAM_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: PWM value to move servo to when shutter is deactivated

param.name: CAM_TRIGG_DIST
param.documentation: Distance in meters between camera triggers. If this value is non-zero then the camera will trigger whenever the GPS position changes by this number of meters regardless of what mode the APM is in. Note that this parameter can also be set in an auto mission using the DO_SET_CAM_TRIGG_DIST command, allowing you to enable/disable the triggering of the camera during the flight.

param.name: CAM_RELAY_ON
param.documentation: This sets whether the relay goes high or low when it triggers. Note that you should also set RELAY_DEFAULT appropriately for your camera

param.name: CAM_MIN_INTERVAL
param.documentation: Postpone shooting if previous picture was taken less than preset time(ms) ago.

param.name: CAM_MAX_ROLL
param.documentation: Postpone shooting if roll is greater than limit. (0=Disable, will shoot regardless of roll).

param.name: CAM_FEEDBACK_PIN
param.documentation: pin number to use for save accurate camera feedback messages. If set to -1 then don't use a pin flag for this, otherwise this is a pin number which if held high after a picture trigger order, will save camera messages when camera really takes a picture. A universal camera hot shoe is needed. The pin should be held high for at least 2 milliseconds for reliable trigger detection. See also the CAM_FEEDBACK_POL option. If using AUX4 pin on a Pixhawk then a fast capture method is used that allows for the trigger time to be as short as one microsecond.

param.name: CAM_FEEDBACK_POL
param.documentation: Polarity for feedback pin. If this is 1 then the feedback pin should go high on trigger. If set to 0 then it should go low

param.name: RELAY_PIN
param.documentation: Digital pin number for first relay control. This is the pin used for camera control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN2
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 2nd relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN3
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 3rd relay control.

param.name: RELAY_PIN4
param.documentation: Digital pin number for 4th relay control.

param.name: RELAY_DEFAULT
param.documentation: The state of the relay on boot.

param.name: EPM_ENABLE
param.documentation: EPM enable/disable

param.name: EPM_GRAB
param.documentation: PWM value sent to EPM to initiate grabbing the cargo

param.name: EPM_RELEASE
param.documentation: PWM value sent to EPM to release the cargo

param.name: EPM_NEUTRAL
param.documentation: PWM value sent to EPM when not grabbing or releasing

param.name: EPM_REGRAB
param.documentation: Time in seconds that gripper will regrab the cargo to ensure grip has not weakend

param.name: CHUTE_ENABLED
param.documentation: Parachute release enabled or disabled

param.humanName: Parachute release mechanism type (relay or servo)
param.name: CHUTE_TYPE
param.documentation: Parachute release mechanism type (relay or servo)

param.name: CHUTE_SERVO_ON
param.documentation: Parachute Servo PWM value when parachute is released

param.name: CHUTE_SERVO_OFF
param.documentation: Parachute Servo PWM value when parachute is not released

param.humanName: Parachute min altitude in meters above home
param.name: CHUTE_ALT_MIN
param.documentation: Parachute min altitude above home. Parachute will not be released below this altitude. 0 to disable alt check.

param.name: CHUTE_DELAY_MS
param.documentation: Delay in millseconds between motor stop and chute release

param.humanName: Landing Gear Servo Retracted PWM Value
param.name: LGR_SERVO_RTRACT
param.documentation: Servo PWM value when landing gear is retracted

param.humanName: Landing Gear Servo Deployed PWM Value
param.name: LGR_SERVO_DEPLOY
param.documentation: Servo PWM value when landing gear is deployed

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to the compass z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.name: COMPASS_DEC
param.documentation: An angle to compensate between the true north and magnetic north

param.name: COMPASS_LEARN
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic learning of compass offsets. You can enable learning either using a compass-only method that is suitable only for fixed wing aircraft or using the offsets learnt by the active EKF state estimator. If this option is enabled then the learnt offsets are saved when you disarm the vehicle.

param.name: COMPASS_USE
param.documentation: Enable or disable the use of the compass (instead of the GPS) for determining heading

param.name: COMPASS_AUTODEC
param.documentation: Enable or disable the automatic calculation of the declination based on gps location

param.name: COMPASS_MOTCT
param.documentation: Set motor interference compensation type to disabled, throttle or current. Do not change manually.

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to the compass's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.name: COMPASS_ORIENT
param.documentation: The orientation of the compass relative to the autopilot board. This will default to the right value for each board type, but can be changed if you have an external compass. See the documentation for your external compass for the right value. The correct orientation should give the X axis forward, the Y axis to the right and the Z axis down. So if your aircraft is pointing west it should show a positive value for the Y axis, and a value close to zero for the X axis. On a PX4 or Pixhawk with an external compass the correct value is zero if the compass is correctly oriented. NOTE: This orientation is combined with any AHRS_ORIENTATION setting.

param.humanName: Compass is attached via an external cable
param.name: COMPASS_EXTERNAL
param.documentation: Configure compass so it is attached externally. This is auto-detected on PX4 and Pixhawk. Set to 1 if the compass is externally connected. When externally connected the COMPASS_ORIENT option operates independently of the AHRS_ORIENTATION board orientation option. If set to 0 or 1 then auto-detection by bus connection can override the value. If set to 2 then auto-detection will be disabled.

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass2 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS2_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass2 for body frame Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT2_Z
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass2's z-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.name: COMPASS_PRIMARY
param.documentation: If more than one compass is available this selects which compass is the primary. Normally 0=External, 1=Internal. If no External compass is attached this parameter is ignored

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the X axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_X
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_Y
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Compass3 offsets in milligauss on the Z axis
param.name: COMPASS_OFS3_Z
param.documentation: Offset to be added to compass3's z-axis values to compensate for metal in the frame

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame X axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_X
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's x-axis values to compensate for motor interference
param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.humanName: Motor interference compensation to compass3 for body frame Y axis
param.name: COMPASS_MOT3_Y
param.documentation: Multiplied by the current throttle and added to compass3's y-axis values to compensate for motor interference

param.field: Offset per Amp or at Full Throttle

param.documentation: Compass device id. Automatically detected, do not set manually

param.name: COMPASS_CAL_FIT
param.documentation: This controls the fitness level required for a successful compass calibration. A lower value makes for a stricter fit (less likely to pass). This is the value used for the primary magnetometer. Other magnetometers get double the value.

param.name: INS_PRODUCT_ID
param.documentation: Which type of IMU is installed (read-only).

param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of X axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Y
param.documentation: Gyro sensor offsets of Y axis. This is setup on each boot during gyro calibrations

param.name: INS_GYROFFS_Z

param.name: INS_GYRO_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for gyroscopes. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.name: INS_ACCEL_FILTER
param.documentation: Filter cutoff frequency for accelerometers. This can be set to a lower value to try to cope with very high vibration levels in aircraft. This option takes effect on the next reboot. A value of zero means no filtering (not recommended!)

param.humanName: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE
param.documentation: Use first IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE2
param.documentation: Use second IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates
param.name: INS_USE3
param.documentation: Use third IMU for attitude, velocity and position estimates

param.humanName: Stillness threshold for detecting if we are moving
param.name: INS_STILL_THRESH
param.documentation: Threshold to tolerate vibration to determine if vehicle is motionless. This depends on the frame type and if there is a constant vibration due to motors before launch or after landing. Total motionless is about 0.05. Suggested values: Planes/rover use 0.1, multirotors use 1, tradHeli uses 5

param.name: INS_GYR_CAL
param.documentation: Conrols when automatic gyro calibration is performed

param.name: INS_TRIM_OPTION
param.documentation: Specifies how the accel cal routine determines the trims

values.value: Assume ACC_BODYFIX is perfectly aligned to the vehicle

param.name: INS_ACC_BODYFIX
param.documentation: The body-fixed accelerometer to be used for trim calculation

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain horizontally during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the distance from a waypoint, that when crossed indicates the wp has been hit.

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED_UP
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while climbing during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_SPEED_DN
param.documentation: Defines the speed in cm/s which the aircraft will attempt to maintain while descending during a WP mission

param.name: WPNAV_LOIT_SPEED
param.documentation: Defines the maximum speed in cm/s which the aircraft will travel horizontally while in loiter mode

param.name: WPNAV_ACCEL
param.documentation: Defines the horizontal acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

param.name: WPNAV_ACCEL_Z
param.documentation: Defines the vertical acceleration in cm/s/s used during missions

param.name: WPNAV_LOIT_JERK
param.documentation: Loiter maximum jerk in cm/s/s/s

param.name: WPNAV_LOIT_MAXA
param.documentation: Loiter maximum acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values cause the copter to accelerate and stop more quickly.

param.name: WPNAV_LOIT_MINA
param.documentation: Loiter minimum acceleration in cm/s/s. Higher values stop the copter more quickly when the stick is centered, but cause a larger jerk when the copter stops.

param.name: CIRCLE_RADIUS
param.documentation: Defines the radius of the circle the vehicle will fly when in Circle flight mode

param.name: CIRCLE_RATE
param.documentation: Circle mode's turn rate in deg/sec. Positive to turn clockwise, negative for counter clockwise

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller P gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired roll rate and actual roll rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_I
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_IMAX
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Roll axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_D
param.documentation: Roll axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired roll rate vs actual roll rate

param.humanName: Roll axis rate conroller input frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_RAT_RLL_FILT
param.documentation: Roll axis rate conroller input frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller P gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_PIT_P
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired pitch rate and actual pitch rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_PIT_I
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ATC_RAT_PIT_IMAX
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_PIT_D
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired pitch rate vs actual pitch rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis rate conroller input frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_RAT_PIT_FILT
param.documentation: Pitch axis rate conroller input frequency in Hz

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller P gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller P gain. Converts the difference between desired yaw rate and actual yaw rate into a motor speed output

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_YAW_I
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller I gain. Corrects long-term difference in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum
param.name: ATC_RAT_YAW_IMAX
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller I gain maximum. Constrains the maximum motor output that the I gain will output

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate controller D gain
param.name: ATC_RAT_YAW_D
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate controller D gain. Compensates for short-term change in desired yaw rate vs actual yaw rate

param.humanName: Yaw axis rate conroller input frequency in Hz
param.name: ATC_RAT_YAW_FILT
param.documentation: Yaw axis rate conroller input frequency in Hz

param.name: ATC_SLEW_YAW
param.documentation: Maximum rate the yaw target can be updated in Loiter, RTL, Auto flight modes

param.name: ATC_ACCEL_Y_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum acceleration in yaw axis

param.name: ATC_RATE_FF_ENAB
param.documentation: Controls whether body-frame rate feedfoward is enabled or disabled

param.name: ATC_ACCEL_R_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum acceleration in roll axis

param.name: ATC_ACCEL_P_MAX
param.documentation: Maximum acceleration in pitch axis

param.name: ATC_ANGLE_BOOST
param.documentation: Angle Boost increases output throttle as the vehicle leans to reduce loss of altitude

param.humanName: Roll axis angle controller P gain
param.name: ATC_ANG_RLL_P
param.documentation: Roll axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired roll angle and actual angle to a desired roll rate

param.humanName: Pitch axis angle controller P gain
param.name: ATC_ANG_PIT_P

param.humanName: Yaw axis angle controller P gain
param.name: ATC_ANG_YAW_P
param.documentation: Yaw axis angle controller P gain. Converts the error between the desired yaw angle and actual angle to a desired yaw rate

param.name: PSC_ACC_XY_FILT
param.documentation: Lower values will slow the response of the navigation controller and reduce twitchiness

param.name: AHRS_GPS_GAIN
param.documentation: This controls how how much to use the GPS to correct the attitude. This should never be set to zero for a plane as it would result in the plane losing control in turns. For a plane please use the default value of 1.0.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_USE
param.documentation: This controls whether to use dead-reckoning or GPS based navigation. If set to 0 then the GPS won't be used for navigation, and only dead reckoning will be used. A value of zero should never be used for normal flight.

param.name: AHRS_YAW_P
param.documentation: This controls the weight the compass or GPS has on the heading. A higher value means the heading will track the yaw source (GPS or compass) more rapidly.

param.name: AHRS_RP_P
param.documentation: This controls how fast the accelerometers correct the attitude

param.name: AHRS_WIND_MAX
param.documentation: This sets the maximum allowable difference between ground speed and airspeed. This allows the plane to cope with a failing airspeed sensor. A value of zero means to use the airspeed as is.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_X
param.documentation: Compensates for the roll angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle roll right.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Y
param.documentation: Compensates for the pitch angle difference between the control board and the frame. Positive values make the vehicle pitch up/back.

param.name: AHRS_TRIM_Z
param.documentation: Not Used

param.name: AHRS_ORIENTATION
param.documentation: Overall board orientation relative to the standard orientation for the board type. This rotates the IMU and compass readings to allow the board to be oriented in your vehicle at any 90 or 45 degree angle. This option takes affect on next boot. After changing you will need to re-level your vehicle.

param.humanName: AHRS Velocity Complementary Filter Beta Coefficient
param.name: AHRS_COMP_BETA
param.documentation: This controls the time constant for the cross-over frequency used to fuse AHRS (airspeed and heading) and GPS data to estimate ground velocity. Time constant is 0.1/beta. A larger time constant will use GPS data less and a small time constant will use air data less.

param.name: AHRS_GPS_MINSATS
param.documentation: Minimum number of satellites visible to use GPS for velocity based corrections attitude correction. This defaults to 6, which is about the point at which the velocity numbers from a GPS become too unreliable for accurate correction of the accelerometers.

param.humanName: Use NavEKF Kalman filter for attitude and position estimation
param.name: AHRS_EKF_TYPE
param.documentation: This controls whether the NavEKF Kalman filter is used for attitude and position estimation and whether fallback to the DCM algorithm is allowed. Note that on copters "disabled" is not available, and will be the same as "enabled - no fallback"

param.name: MNT_DEFLT_MODE
param.documentation: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position
param.name: MNT_RETRACT_Z
param.documentation: Mount yaw/pan angle when in retracted position

param.humanName: Mount roll angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_X
param.documentation: Mount roll angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_Y
param.documentation: Mount tilt/pitch angle when in neutral position

param.humanName: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position
param.name: MNT_NEUTRAL_Z
param.documentation: Mount pan/yaw angle when in neutral position

param.documentation: enable roll stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_STAB_TILT
param.documentation: enable tilt/pitch stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_STAB_PAN
param.documentation: enable pan/yaw stabilisation relative to Earth

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_ROLL
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_ROL
param.documentation: Minimum physical roll angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Maximum physical roll angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_TILT
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_TIL
param.documentation: Minimum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_TIL
param.documentation: Maximum physical tilt (pitch) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_RC_IN_PAN
param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control pan (yaw) movements

param.name: MNT_ANGMIN_PAN
param.documentation: Minimum physical pan (yaw) angular position of mount.

param.name: MNT_ANGMAX_PAN
param.documentation: Maximum physical pan (yaw) angular position of the mount

param.name: MNT_JSTICK_SPD
param.documentation: 0 for position control, small for low speeds, 100 for max speed. A good general value is 10 which gives a movement speed of 3 degrees per second.

param.name: MNT_LEAD_RLL
param.documentation: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate, compensating for servo delay. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

param.name: MNT_LEAD_PTCH
param.documentation: Causes the servo angle output to lead the current angle of the vehicle by some amount of time based on current angular rate. Increase until the servo is responsive but doesn't overshoot. Does nothing with pan stabilization enabled.

param.name: MNT_TYPE
param.documentation: Mount Type (None, Servo or MAVLink)

param.documentation: Mount default operating mode on startup and after control is returned from autopilot

param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control roll movements

param.documentation: Mount2's minimum physical roll angular position

param.name: MNT2_ANGMAX_ROL
param.documentation: Mount2's maximum physical roll angular position

param.documentation: 0 for none, any other for the RC channel to be used to control tilt (pitch) movements

param.name: MNT2_ANGMIN_TIL
